intro: Chenopodium neomexicanum, commonly known as Mexican goosefoot, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it typically grows in disturbed soils and arid environments. The plant has alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, greenish flowers in clusters. It is an annual plant that thrives in full sun and is often found in dry, sandy soils. The seeds of Chenopodium neomexicanum are small and can be dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
